title: Error 401: Incorrect LLM Vendor or API Key
description: Learn how to troubleshoot and resolve Error 401 when using mismatched API keys
content:
## Why This Error Occurs

This error indicates that you are using an incorrect LLM vendor. The API key you provided does not match the selected model provider. For example, selecting GPT models while using a ClaudeAI API key will result in this error.

The typical message is:

```
HTTP error! status: 401, message: {
 "error": {
   "message": "Incorrect API key provided: olly-ef6**c694. You can find your API key at https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys./",
   "type": "invalid_request_error",
   "param": null,
   "code": "invalid_api_key"
 }
}
```

## Steps to Resolve

1. **Check Your API Key**: Ensure you are using the correct API key.
2. **Verify the LLM Model**: Select the correct model that matches your API key.
3. **Update in Olly Extension**: Go to the Olly extension and make sure you have selected the appropriate model and API key.

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

1. **What does Error 401 mean?**\
   *It means your API key is incorrect or does not match the selected LLM vendor.*

2. **How do I find my correct API key?**\
   *Check the API key section on your LLM provider's platform.*

title: Error 404: Model Not Available
description: Learn how to troubleshoot and resolve Error 404 when accessing AI models
content:
## Why This Error Occurs

This error occurs when the model you are trying to use is either deprecated or unavailable. It typically presents the following message:

```
HTTP error! status: 404, message: {
 "error": {
   "message": "The model gpt-4 does not exist or you do not have access to it."
 }
}
```

## Steps to Resolve

1. **Check Model Availability**: Verify if the model you are trying to use is still supported.
2. **Update to the Latest Version**: Switch to the most recent version of the model.
3. **Check Access Permissions**: Ensure you have the necessary permissions to use the model.
4. **Restart Your API Connection**: Sometimes, reconnecting to the API can help resolve the issue.

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

1. **What does Error 404 mean in API usage?**\
   *It means the requested model is unavailable or does not exist.*

2. **How do I know which models are available?**\
   *Check the official documentation or API dashboard for available models.*

3. **Can I still use older models?**\
   *Only if they are still supported and you have access to them.*

title: Error 500: Internal Server Error
description: Learn how to troubleshoot and resolve Error 500 when experiencing server-side issues
content:
## Why This Error Occurs

This error is typically temporary and may be caused by an outage on a server or cloud provider. It can occur multiple times within a short period.

The typical message is:

```
HTTP error! status: 500, message: {"success":false,"error":"\nInvalid prisma.apiKey.findUnique() invocation:\n\n\nCan't reach database server at junction.proxy.rlwy.net:55649\n\nPlease make sure your database server is running at junction.proxy.rlwy.net:55649."}
```

## Steps to Resolve

1. **Wait for Automatic Resolution**: This error often resolves automatically as the server issue is fixed.
2. **Refresh the Web Page**: Reload the page to check if the issue resolves.
3. **Close All Tabs**: Shut down all browser tabs and reopen the application.
4. **Restart Your Device**: If the error persists, restart your device to reset connections.

## Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

1. **What does Error 500 mean?**\
   *It indicates a server-side issue, often due to an outage or temporary failure.*

2. **Is this error caused by my device or settings?**\
   *No, this is usually a server issue and not related to your device.*

3. **How long does it take for Error 500 to resolve?**\
   *It is typically resolved quickly once the server issue is fixed.*

content:
# Olly Auto Commenter Configuration Guide

**Learn how to configure the Auto Commenter feature for LinkedIn automation to save time and increase your social media presence.**

**Keywords:** Olly configuration, Auto Commenter, LinkedIn automation, Chrome extension, social media engagement, auto comment

***

![Banner](/images/banner.png "Olly Auto Commenter")

***

## Introduction

This guide will walk you through configuring the Olly Auto Commenter feature for LinkedIn automation. The Auto Commenter allows you to automatically engage with LinkedIn content while you browse the web, saving you time and increasing your social media presence.

> **Prefer video instructions?** [Watch our video guide to Auto Commenter setup](https://youtu.be/HzIC8kpePwU) (opens in new window)

***

## Quick Links

### Installation

**Mac Installation Guide**\
Before configuring, make sure to install the Olly application on macOS.\
[‚Üí Go to Mac Installation Guide](/docs/installation/mac)

### Configuration

**Auto Commenter Setup**\
Learn how to configure the Auto Commenter for LinkedIn engagement.\
[‚Üí Go to Configuration Guide](/docs/features/auto-commenter/configuration)

### Support

**Help Center**\
Get assistance and troubleshooting tips for the Olly Auto Commenter.\
[‚Üí Go to Help Center](/docs/support)

***

## Before You Begin

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Important

To use the Auto Commenter feature in the background while you browse, you must first install the full Olly application on your Mac. This allows Olly to run continuously and engage with supporting social media's platforms even when you're not actively on the social media site.

‚Üí **[Follow our Mac Installation Guide here](/docs/installation/mac)**

If you've already installed the Olly app, you can proceed with configuring the Auto Commenter below.

***

## Important Information Before Setup

### 1. LLM Provider Requirement

‚ö†Ô∏è **Auto Commenter only supports the Olly API** and does not work with any other LLM provider. This is because other LLM providers do not provide the necessary permissions to perform background activity required for automated engagement.

### 2. Platform Support

‚ö†Ô∏è **Auto Commenter now supports 5 platforms:**

* Instagram
* LinkedIn
* TikTok
* Twitter
* Facebook

***

## Configuring Olly Auto Commenter

### Step 1: Open Olly Extension

Click on the Olly icon in your Chrome extensions toolbar to open the extension popup.

***

### Step 2: Enable and Sync

In the Olly popup window:

1. Toggle the **"Enable"** switch to ON
2. Toggle the **"Sync"** switch to ON

![Sync Icon](/images/features/auto-commenter/step1.png)

***

### Step 3: Access Settings

Click on the **"Settings"** gear icon on the right side of the popup.

![Settings Icon](/images/features/auto-commenter/step2.png)

***

### Step 4: Set Up Auto Commenter

1. In the settings menu, find and click on the **"Auto Commenter"** option
2. Click on **"Setup Auto Commenter"** button

![Auto Commenter Settings](/images/features/auto-commenter/step3.png)

***

### Step 5: Configure LinkedIn Integration

1. You will be redirected to the Olly dashboard: `https://www.olly.social/dashboard/auto-commenter/config`
2. **Select platforms** where you want to use Auto Commenter feature
3. Review your License Key (should be automatically filled)
4. You can copy the license key using the button if needed
5. The system will confirm that this license is valid for the configuration

**Additional Features Available:**

* **Use Your Existing Brand Voice:** You can now use your existing brand voice or you can create a new brand voice if you don't have the existing one in the Auto Commenter so that your responses will feel more human-generated and authentic to your personal or company style.

* **Promote Your Product:** Include product promotion in automated interactions to naturally showcase what you offer while engaging with content.
  * **Product Details:** Provide details about what you're promoting. This information will be used to generate relevant comments that seamlessly incorporate your product or service.

![Dashboard Auto Commenter](/images/features/auto-commenter/step4.png)

***

### Step 6: Content Configuration

#### Set Engagement Limits:

‚ö†Ô∏è You can set a default maximum of **10 comments** and **10 likes** per run. Additionally, you can add up to **3 target keywords (3 hashtags)** to focus your engagement.

#### Important - Balancing Comments Between Feed and Keywords:

‚ö†Ô∏è You need to distribute your 10 comments between the general feed and your target keywords.

**Example:**

* If you add 4 comments on the general feed and you are targeting 3 keywords, you have 6 comments remaining
* This means you can only add 2 comments per keyword (6 comments √∑ 3 keywords = 2 comments per keyword)
* You must adjust the 10 comment count between feed engagement and keyword targeting

![LinkedIn Configuration - Content Tab](/images/features/auto-commenter/step6.png)

**If you select "Use Custom Prompt", you can:**

* Enter your custom instructions for comment generation
* Add signature text to appear at the end of each comment

**Complete the Configuration:**

* On the final page, click **"Save Configuration"**

![LinkedIn Configuration - Content Tab](/images/features/auto-commenter/step6-1.png)

***

### Step 7: Sync Your Configuration

1. Return to the Chrome extension
2. Click on the **"Sync"** icon to pull your new configuration

![Sync Configuration](/images/features/auto-commenter/step8.png)

***

### Step 8: Verify Auto Commenter Settings

1. Click on the **"Settings"** gear icon
2. Check the **"Auto Commenter"** tab to confirm your configuration appears

![Verify Configuration](/images/features/auto-commenter/step9.png)

***

## Feature Benefits

* **Time Saving:** Automate engagement on LinkedIn posts while you browse the web
* **Increased Visibility:** Regular engagement helps boost your profile's visibility
* **Consistent Presence:** Maintain an active presence even when you're busy
* **Smart Responses:** AI-generated comments that are contextually relevant
* **Customizable:** Set your own engagement parameters and comment style

***

## Who Will This Feature Help?

### 1. Social Media Managers

Easily manage LinkedIn engagement across multiple accounts while focusing on other important tasks

### 2. Marketers & Content Creators

Maintain consistent engagement without spending hours manually commenting on posts

### 3. Business Professionals

Build your personal brand on LinkedIn with minimal time investment

### 4. Job Seekers

Increase your visibility within your professional network when looking for opportunities

***

## Using Auto Commenter in Background Mode

### Do You Want to Use Auto Commenter in the Background?

To use Olly Auto Commenter in the background (while you continue browsing other websites), you need to have the full Olly application installed on your Mac.

* **If you haven't installed Olly yet:** Follow our [Mac Installation Guide](/docs/installation/mac) first
* **If you've already installed Olly:** You can proceed to activate background mode below

***

### Activating Auto Commenter on LinkedIn

#### Step 9: Navigate to Social Media Platform Where You Want to Use Auto Commenter

1. Navigate to Social Media in your browser
2. The Olly popup icon should appear on the right side of your screen
3. Hover over it and click on the **"Auto Engage"** button
4. A small window will open in the top right corner and will begin the auto commenting process

![LinkedIn with Olly Activated](/images/features/auto-commenter/step10.png)

***

#### Step 10: Background Operation

1. You can minimize the small window and continue browsing the web
2. The Auto Commenter will engage on your behalf in the background
3. You can click the **"Stop auto comment"** button at any time to halt the process
4. When the process completes or is stopped, the window will automatically close

![Background Operation](/images/features/auto-commenter/step11.png)

***

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues:

* **Extension not appearing:** Verify Chrome launched with the unthrottled parameters
* **Configuration not syncing:** Try toggling the Sync button off and on again
* **Auto Commenter not starting:** Ensure you're logged into LinkedIn and refresh the page
* **Comments not posting:** Check your daily limits and ensure your LinkedIn account is in good standing
* **Background mode not working:** Make sure the full Olly app is installed and running

For additional support or feature requests, please contact support at **support@olly.social** or visit our [Help Center](/docs/introduction).

* Enhances the quality and authenticity of all Olly-generated responses

How To Create Custom Actions ### Step 1: Open the Olly Extension Launch the Olly extension from your browser toolbar by clicking on the Olly icon in your Chrome extensions. ### Step 2: Go to Settings Click on the gear icon or select Settings within the extension interface. ![Settings Icon](/images/features/custom-actions/custom-action-step1.png) ### Step 3: Navigate to Custom Actions In the sidebar, go to the Custom Actions section. ![Custom Actions Menu](/images/features/custom-actions/custom-action-step2.png) ### Step 4: Fill in Custom Action Details Complete the following fields to create your custom action: **Title**: Give your action a clear and descriptive name * Examples: Post Analyst, Quiz Generator, Content Rewriter, Rap Generator, Story Creator **Action Type**: Choose the type of action from the dropdown list * Available types: comment, summary, virality checker * Note: Action type will be auto-generated based on the action title **Emoji**: Add a relevant emoji to help you quickly identify the action * The emoji will appear as an indicator (‚ò∫Ô∏è) when using the action **Prompt**: Write the instruction or idea for what the action should do * Examples: * "Generate a funny rap about AI" * "Turn this post into a quiz" * "Analyze this post for virality potential" * "Rewrite this content in a professional tone" ![Custom Action Configuration](/images/features/custom-actions/custom-action-step3.png) ### Step 5: Save Your Custom Action Once all fields are filled in, click Save to store your custom action. ![Save Custom Action](/images/features/custom-actions/custom-action-step4.png) ## content: ![Banner](/images/banner.png "Disabling Olly on Specific Websites") ## Introduction This guide will walk you through managing Olly's presence across different websites. With this powerful feature, you can decide where Olly is active and where it stays hidden, giving you complete flexibility and control over your browsing experience. > **Prefer video instructions?** Watch our video guide to managing Olly's website presence (opens in new window) ## What Is This Feature? We've added a powerful new feature that lets you manage Olly's presence across different websites. Now, you can decide where Olly is active and where it stays hidden, giving you complete flexibility! This feature allows you to maintain a customized browsing experience by selectively enabling or disabling Olly on specific websites based on your needs. ## Feature Benefits * **Customized Experience**: Control exactly where Olly appears, tailoring your browsing to your specific needs * **Clutter-Free Workspace**: Keep your interface clean by disabling Olly on sites where you don't need it * **Improved Focus**: Maintain a distraction-free environment on work-related or professional websites * **Flexible Management**: Easily add or remove websites from your disabled list at any time * **Multi-Platform Control**: Manage Olly's presence across all the platforms you use * **Enhanced Performance**: Reduce resource usage by limiting Olly to only the sites where you need it ## Who Will This Feature Help? ### 1. Social Media Managers If you manage multiple accounts across different platforms, this feature allows you to disable Olly on specific sites where you don't need it, ensuring a clutter-free workspace and smoother workflow. Focus on the platforms that matter most for each client or project. ### 2. Marketers & Content Creators Whether you're running ad campaigns or crafting engaging content, you can focus on the platforms that matter most while keeping Olly disabled on sites where you don't need automated suggestions. Streamline your creative process by controlling where assistance is provided. ### 3. Business Professionals If you use Olly for social engagement but want to keep it disabled on work-related websites, this feature helps you maintain a distraction-free professional environment. Separate your social media activities from your professional browsing. ### 4. Casual Users If you only want to use Olly on specific platforms, you can easily customize its presence and keep your browsing experience clean and personalized. Enjoy Olly's features exactly where you want them, without any unnecessary interference. ## How to Manage Olly's Presence ### Step 1: Open the Olly Chrome Extension Click on the Olly icon in your browser toolbar to access the extension. **‚Üí [Learn how to install the Chrome extension here](/https://docs.olly.social/docs/installation/adding-to-chrome)** ![Open Olly Extension](/images/features/disable-olly/disabling-olly-on-specific-websites-step1.png) ### Step 2: Go to "Olly Configuration" Navigate to the Olly Configuration inside the extension settings section where you can customize your Olly experience. ### Step 3: "Disable Olly On Specific Website " Find this option in the settings to control where Olly appears. This section will display a list of websites where you can manage Olly's presence. ![Disable Olly On Section](/images/features/disable-olly/disabling-olly-on-specific-websites-step3.png) ### Step 4: Add Website URLs Simply enter the URLs of the websites where you want to manage Olly's presence. You can add multiple websites to create a comprehensive list of sites where Olly should remain disabled. **URL Format Examples:** * `linkedin.com` * `twitter.com` * `facebook.com` * `instagram.com` * `yourworksite.com` ![Add Website URLs](/images/features/disable-olly/disabling-olly-on-specific-websites-step4.png) ## Managing Your Disabled Websites List ### Adding Multiple Websites You can add as many websites as needed to your disabled list: 1. Enter the website URL in the input field 2. Click "Add" or press Enter 3. The website will appear in your disabled list 4. Repeat for each additional website ### Removing Websites from the List To re-enable Olly on a previously disabled website: 1. Locate the website in your disabled list 2. Click the remove or delete icon next to the URL 3. The website will be removed from the list 4. Olly will become active on that website again ### Editing Website URLs If you need to modify a URL: 1. Remove the existing URL from the list 2. Add the corrected URL 3. Save your changes ## Use Cases by Scenario ### Scenario 1: Multi-Account Management Disable Olly on client accounts where you need to maintain a specific brand voice without AI assistance, while keeping it active on your personal or company accounts. ### Scenario 2: Work-Life Separation Keep Olly disabled on work-related platforms during business hours, then enable it on social media platforms for personal engagement during your free time. ### Scenario 3: Platform-Specific Strategy If you have different engagement strategies for different platforms, disable Olly on platforms where you prefer manual interaction while using it on others for efficiency. ### Scenario 4: Testing and Comparison Disable Olly on certain platforms to compare engagement metrics with and without AI assistance, helping you optimize your social media strategy. ### Scenario 5: Professional Networking Keep Olly disabled on professional networking sites like LinkedIn during job searches or client interactions, while using it freely on more casual social platforms. ## Best Practices * **Start Selective**: Begin by disabling Olly only on sites where you're certain you don't need it * **Review Regularly**: Periodically review your disabled list and adjust based on your changing needs * **Test Before Committing**: Try disabling Olly on a site temporarily to see if it improves your workflow * **Use Clear URLs**: Enter complete and accurate website URLs to ensure proper functionality * **Document Your Choices**: Keep track of why you disabled Olly on specific sites for future reference * **Balance Automation**: Find the right balance between automated assistance and manual control * **Update as Needed**: Don't hesitate to re-enable Olly on sites if your needs change ## Troubleshooting If you encounter any issues: * **Olly still appearing on disabled sites**: Clear your browser cache and cookies, then restart Chrome * **Unable to add websites**: Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date * **Settings not saving**: Check that you have the latest version of the Olly extension installed * **Extension conflicts**: Try disabling other extensions temporarily to check for conflicts * **URLs not recognized**: Ensure you're entering the correct URL format without "https://" or "www" unless necessary * **Changes not taking effect**: Refresh the webpage or restart your browser after making changes ### Additional Troubleshooting Steps * Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date * Try disabling other extensions temporarily to check for conflicts * Clear your browser cache and cookies, then restart Chrome * Uninstall and reinstall the Olly extension if issues persist * Check that JavaScript is enabled in your browser settings For additional support or feature requests, please contact support at support@olly.social or visit our [Help Center](/docs/introduction). ***

Olly powers communication in 20+ languages including English, Spanish, Chinese, Arabic, French, German, Japanese, Russian, Portuguese, Hindi, and many more regional languages worldwide. With Post Native Language support, Olly can automatically detect and respond in the language of any post you engage with. > **Prefer video instructions?** Watch our video guide to language configuration (opens in new window) ## Supported Languages Olly powers communication in **20+ languages** including: * English * Spanish * Chinese * Arabic * French * German * Japanese * Russian * Portuguese * Hindi * And many more regional languages worldwide ## Feature Benefits * **Global Reach**: Engage with audiences in their native languages across 20+ supported languages * **Automatic Detection**: Post Native Language feature automatically matches the language of any post * **Consistent Messaging**: Maintain linguistic consistency throughout conversations * **Cultural Respect**: Demonstrate cultural awareness by communicating in native languages * **Time Savings**: Eliminate the need for manual translation or language switching * **Enhanced Engagement**: Build stronger connections with international audiences * **Professional Communication**: Deliver polished, native-quality responses in multiple languages ## How to Comment in Different Languages ### Step 1: Open Olly Configuration In the Olly Extension, go to Configuration settings. ![Open Olly Configuration](/images/features/native-language/change-language-step1.png) ### Step 2: Select Language In Configuration, scroll down to find "Select Language." Navigate to any post and use Olly to see comments generated in your selected language. ![Generated Comment in Selected Language](/images/features/native-language/comment-result.png) ## Post Native Language Support ### What is Post Native Language Support? The "Post Native Language" feature automatically generates comments in the language of the original post when enabled. This functionality helps maintain linguistic consistency throughout conversations and improves engagement with international audiences. **Example:** If someone creates a post in Japanese, enabling this feature would automatically generate responses or comments in Japanese rather than in another language like English. ### How It Works When Post Native Language is enabled: 1. Olly analyzes the language of the original post 2. Automatically detects the native language being used 3. Generates comments in that same language 4. Maintains context and cultural nuances 5. Ensures seamless multilingual conversations ## Who Will This Feature Help? ### 1. Global Journalists International reporters can connect with diverse audiences by engaging with reader comments in their native languages and responding to sources in multiple countries without translation delays. This helps them build credibility with local communities, gather diverse perspectives for stories, and maintain authentic connections across cultural boundaries. ### 2. Multinational CEOs Business leaders benefit from communicating directly with international teams and engaging with customers in various markets. This feature enables them to build rapport with global stakeholders, deliver consistent messaging across languages, and demonstrate cultural respect through native language engagement. ### 3. International Educators Professors can enhance their impact by responding to student questions in their native languages and making educational content more accessible globally. This helps create inclusive learning environments, build meaningful connections with international students, and expand their teaching influence across linguistic boundaries. ### 4. Diplomatic Officials Diplomats can strengthen relations by communicating policy positions in multiple languages and engaging directly with citizens of various nations. This feature helps them build trust through linguistic respect, navigate complex international conversations, and demonstrate cultural competence through language. ### 5. Global Nonprofit Leaders Humanitarian leaders can amplify their impact by connecting with beneficiaries in their own languages and sharing mission updates with global supporters. This enables them to build trust in diverse communities, coordinate international teams more effectively, and create inclusive dialogue around important causes. ## How to Enable Post Native Language Feature ### Step 1: Open Olly Extension and Configuration Open the Olly Extension and navigate to Olly Configuration settings. ![Open Olly Configuration](/images/features/native-language/native-language-support-step1.png) ### Step 2: Find and Enable Native Language In Olly Configuration, scroll down and look for "Post Native Language" option and enable it. ![Enable Post Native Language](/images/features/native-language/native-language-support-step2.png) ### Step 3: Automatic Language Detection The Post Native Language feature automatically generates comments in the original language of any post. For example, if you're engaging with a Spanish post, Olly will generate comments in Spanish without requiring you to manually change the language settings each time. ![Automatic Language Detection in Action](/images/features/native-language/auto-detection.png) ## Choosing Between Manual and Native Language Settings ### Use Manual Language Selection When: * You want all comments in a specific language regardless of the post language * You're managing a single-language account or brand * You prefer consistency across all your engagements * You're focusing on a specific market or region ### Use Post Native Language When: * You engage with international content regularly * You want to match the language of each post automatically * You're building a global presence * You value linguistic and cultural authenticity * You interact with diverse, multilingual audiences ## Language Support Best Practices ### For Global Engagement * Enable Post Native Language to automatically match post languages * Review generated comments to ensure cultural appropriateness * Understand basic cultural nuances for your target languages * Use native language speakers to verify important communications * Monitor engagement metrics across different languages ### For Regional Focus * Set your manual language to your primary market * Disable Post Native Language if you only engage with one region * Create custom buttons with region-specific tones * Maintain consistent brand voice across all language interactions ### For Multilingual Teams * Establish language guidelines for different team members * Use Post Native Language for international community management * Create language-specific custom actions for different markets * Document which languages are used for which client accounts ## Use Cases by Scenario ### Scenario 1: International Brand Management A global brand uses Post Native Language to engage with customers in France, Japan, and Brazil, automatically responding in French, Japanese, and Portuguese respectively. ### Scenario 2: Academic Research A professor researching international education trends engages with posts from colleagues worldwide, automatically commenting in their native languages to build authentic relationships. ### Scenario 3: Diplomatic Outreach A diplomatic official engages with citizens from multiple nations, using Post Native Language to demonstrate respect and build trust through native language communication. ### Scenario 4: Multilingual Marketing Campaign A marketing agency manages campaigns across different regions, using manual language selection for scheduled posts while enabling Native Language for real-time engagement. ### Scenario 5: Global Nonprofit Advocacy A humanitarian organization shares stories and updates with supporters worldwide, automatically responding to comments in each supporter's native language. ## Troubleshooting If you encounter any issues: * **Language not changing**: Clear your browser cache and cookies, then restart Chrome * **Wrong language detected**: Manually select the correct language in configuration settings * **Native Language not working**: Ensure the Post Native Language toggle is enabled * **Poor translation quality**: Try rephrasing your custom prompts with clearer instructions * **Language not supported**: Check the supported languages list and select the closest alternative * **Settings not saving**: Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date * **Extension conflicts**: Try disabling other extensions temporarily to check for conflicts ### Additional Troubleshooting Steps * Make sure your Chrome browser is up to date * Try disabling other extensions temporarily to check for conflicts * Clear your browser cache and cookies, then restart Chrome * Verify that you have the latest version of Olly installed * Test with different posts to ensure the feature is working consistently ## Frequently Asked Questions **Q: Can I use multiple languages simultaneously?** A: Post Native Language automatically adapts to each post's language. For manual selection, choose one default language at a time. **Q: How accurate are the translations?** A: Olly provides native-quality translations for major languages, but we recommend reviewing generated content for important communications. **Q: Can I add custom phrases in different languages?** A: Yes, you can create custom actions with language-specific prompts and instructions. **Q: Will Post Native Language work with all 20+ supported languages?** A: Yes, the feature supports automatic detection and generation across all supported languages. **Q: Can I switch between manual and native language modes easily?** A: Yes, simply toggle the Post Native Language option on or off in your configuration settings. For additional support or feature requests, please contact support at support@olly.social or visit our [Help Center](/docs/introduction). ***

* **Smart Scheduling:** Choose optimal posting times to maximize reach and engagement across different platforms
* **Content Pipeline:** Visualize your entire content strategy in a calendar view for better planning and consistency

## Using Your Calendar Dashboard

### Accessing Your Calendar

#### Step 1: Navigate to Calendar Section

1. Log in to your Olly dashboard at `https://www.olly.social/dashboard`
2. Navigate to the **"Social Media Calendar"** section from the main menu
3. You'll see your calendar view with all scheduled, drafted, and published posts

#### Step 2: View Calendar Modes

1. Switch between different calendar views (day, week, month)
2. Filter posts by platform or status

4. Color-coded indicators help identify post status at a glance

#### Step 3: Manage Your Content

1. Click on any date to create a new post
2. Drag and drop posts to reschedule them
3. Click on existing posts to edit or view details
4. Use bulk actions to manage multiple posts simultaneously

## Best Practices

### Content Planning

* **Plan Ahead:** Schedule content at least one week in advance for consistent posting
* **Use References:** Save high-performing posts as references to guide future content
* **Mix Content Types:** Balance promotional, educational, and entertaining posts
* **Optimal Timing:** Schedule posts during peak engagement hours for your audience

* **Keyword Optimization:** Use relevant keywords in the Ideas Generator for better suggestions
* **Review AI Content:** Always review and personalize AI-generated content before publishing
* **Learn from Scores:** Pay attention to engagement scores to understand what works

### Organization

* **Use Drafts:** Save work-in-progress posts as drafts to refine later
* **Regular Reviews:** Check your Posts tab weekly to monitor status and performance
* **Archive Old Content:** Keep your calendar clean by archiving outdated posts
* **Team Collaboration:** Use clear naming conventions if multiple team members access the calendar

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues:

* **Posts not publishing:** Check that your social media accounts are still properly connected and authorized
* **Integration errors:** Reconnect your social media accounts through the Integrations panel
* **Enhancement not working:** Ensure you have an active internet connection and sufficient plan quota
* **Images not uploading:** Verify image format (JPG, PNG) and size limits (under 5MB recommended)
* **Calendar not loading:** Clear browser cache, refresh the page, or try a different browser
* **Schedule conflicts:** Check for duplicate posts scheduled at the same time
* **Ideas not generating:** Verify you've added at least 5 keywords and selected a category

## Frequently Asked Questions

### How many posts can I schedule in advance?

There is no limit to the number of posts you can schedule. However, platform-specific posting limits may apply.

### Can I schedule posts to multiple platforms simultaneously?

Yes, when creating a post, you can select multiple connected platforms to publish to all of them at once.

### What happens if my social media connection expires?

You'll receive a notification to reconnect your account. Scheduled posts will be paused until reconnection is complete.

### Can I edit a post after it's published?

Once published, you cannot edit through Olly. However, you can edit directly on the platform or delete and repost.

### How accurate are the viral idea engagement scores?

Engagement scores are AI-predicted based on historical performance data and current trends. Actual results may vary.

Yes, you can export your content calendar and analytics data from the Settings menu.

This guide will walk you through the process of setting up Ollama to work with the Olly Chrome Extension.

![Ollama Setup](/images/installation/ollama.png)

## 1. Download and Install Ollama

* Visit the [Ollama download page](https://ollama.com/download).
* Download the appropriate version for your operating system.
* Install Ollama following the on-screen instructions.

## 2. Select and Download an LLM Model

* Browse available models at the [Ollama library](https://ollama.com/library).
* Find your desired model and copy its repository name using the copy icon.
* Open your terminal and paste the copied command to download the model.

## 3. Confirm Model Download

Verify the model download by running the following command in your terminal:

```bash
ollama run "model_name"
```

Replace `model_name` with the name of the model you downloaded (without quotes).

## 4. Operating System-Specific Setup

### 4.1 macOS Setup

#### 4.1.1 Check if Ollama is running

Open Terminal and run:

```bash
ps aux | grep ollama
```

#### 4.1.2 Set the Environment Variable

In Terminal, run:

```bash
launchctl setenv OLLAMA_ORIGINS "chrome-extension://ofjpapfmglfjdhmadpegoeifocomaeje"
```

#### 4.1.3 Restart Ollama

* If Ollama is running in your menu bar, right-click and select "Quit".
* Restart the Ollama application.

#### 4.1.4 Verify the Configuration

In Terminal, run:

```bash
curl -I -H "Origin: chrome-extension://ofjpapfmglfjdhmadpegoeifocomaeje" http://localhost:11434/api/version
```

### 4.2 Windows Setup

#### 4.2.1 Check if Ollama is running

Open Command Prompt and run:

```bash
tasklist | findstr ollama
```

#### 4.2.2 Set the Environment Variable

In Command Prompt (run as Administrator), execute:

```bash
setx OLLAMA_ORIGINS "chrome-extension://ofjpapfmglfjdhmadpegoeifocomaeje"
```

#### 4.2.3 Restart Ollama

* Close Ollama completely.
* Restart the Ollama application.

#### 4.2.4 Verify the Configuration

Open a new Command Prompt and run:

```bash
curl -I -H "Origin: chrome-extension://ofjpapfmglfjdhmadpegoeifocomaeje" http://localhost:11434/api/version
```

## 5. Configure Olly Chrome Extension

* Open the Olly Chrome extension.
* In the "API Key & LLM Vendor" dropdown, select "Local (Ollama)".
* For the API key field, you can enter any text as it operates locally.

## 6. Ensure Ollama is Running

* Make sure to keep Ollama running on your local system at all times for seamless integration with the Olly Chrome extension.

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues:

* Ensure Ollama is properly installed and running.
* Verify that the environment variable is set correctly.
* Check that the selected model is downloaded and accessible.

## Installing Olly on macOS

### Step 1: Download the Application

1. Visit [www.olly.social/downloads](https://www.olly.social/downloads) in your web browser
2. Click the **Download Now** button in the green button
3. You will see the download start (typically as a `output.zip` file of approximately 9.8 MB)

![Download Page](/images/features/mac-install/step1.png)

### Step 2: Extract the Application

1. Locate the downloaded `output.zip` file in your Downloads folder
2. Double-click to extract it or right-click and select "Extract"
3. A folder named "output" will be created containing the Olly application (approximately 10 MB)

![Extracted Folder](/images/features/mac-install/step2.png)

### Step 3: Move to Applications Folder

1. After extraction, an installer window will appear showing the Olly app icon on the left and the Applications folder icon on the right
2. Drag the Olly app icon (teal square with robot icon) to the Applications folder icon (blue folder with the "A" symbol)
3. This action installs Olly in your Applications folder, making it easier to find and launch

![Move to Applications](/images/features/mac-install/step-move.png)

### Step 4: Handle Security Warnings

When you try to open the application, macOS will display security warnings because the app isn't signed by an identified developer. Here's how to handle these warnings:

#### If you see "olly cannot be opened ..."

1. Click "Cancel" on the initial warning
2. Open System Settings and navigate to "Privacy & Security"
3. Scroll down to the Security section where you'll see a message: "olly was blocked to protect your Mac"
4. Click the "Open Anyway" button

![Security Warning](/images/features/mac-install/step31.png)
![Privacy Settings](/images/features/mac-install/step32.png)
![Privacy Settings](/images/features/mac-install/step33.png)

#### If you see "Open olly?" warning

1. A new dialog will appear asking "Open olly?"
2. The warning will state: "Apple is not able to verify that it is free from malware that could harm your Mac or compromise your privacy"
3. Click "Open Anyway" if you trust the source

### Step 5: Grant Necessary Permissions

The app may request certain permissions to function properly:

1. You may be asked to allow Olly to update or delete other applications
2. Toggle the permission switch to ON for Olly
3. If prompted that "olly will not be able to update or delete other applications until it is quit", you can click "Later" or "Quit & Reopen" as needed

### Step 6: Launch Chrome with Olly

When you launch Olly, it will check if Chrome is running:

1. If Chrome is already running, you'll see a prompt: "Chrome is currently running. Do you want to close it and launch with unthrottled parameters?"
2. Click "Yes" to close Chrome and relaunch it with optimized settings for Olly extension

### Step 7: Verifying Installation

1. After clicking "Yes", Chrome should launch automatically with the unthrottled parameters
2. You may see a notification in Chrome that "Olly was prevented from modifying your Mac" - this is normal
3. Your Chrome should now be running with enhanced performance settings and the Olly extension installed

## Next Steps

Now that you've successfully installed Olly on your Mac, you can proceed to set up and configure the Auto Commenter feature for LinkedIn automation. This will allow you to engage with LinkedIn content automatically while you browse the web.

‚Üí [Configure Olly Auto Commenter](/docs/features/auto-commenter)

## Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues during installation:

* **Extraction problems**: Try using a different extraction tool or download the file again
* **Security warnings persisting**: Ensure you're following all steps in the security section above
* **Chrome not launching properly**: Try manually closing all Chrome windows and then launching Olly again
* **Permission issues**: Make sure you're logged into your Mac with an administrator account

For additional support, please contact support at support@olly.social or visit our [Help Center](/docs/introduction).

## Basic Algebra

The area of a circle ($$A$$) can be calculated using the radius ($$r$$) as follows:

```math
A = \pi r^2
```

## Quadratic Formula

The quadratic formula for solving an equation of the form $$ax^2 + bx + c = 0$$ is:

```math
x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}
```

## Newton's Second Law of Motion

Newton's second law of motion states that force ($$F$$) is the product of mass ($$m$$) and acceleration ($$a$$):

```math
F = ma
```

## Pythagorean Theorem

The Pythagorean theorem relates the lengths of the sides of a right triangle:

```math
a^2 + b^2 = c^2
```

## Einstein's Mass-Energy Equivalence

Einstein's famous equation relates energy ($$E$$), mass ($$m$$), and the speed of light ($$c$$):

```math
E = mc^2
```
